creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: large, abstract tan figure in center with thick black lines outlining its shape; thick black swirl at LLC with upward curving thick black lines extending from its R side; the lines contain thick circles and squares; small red, white, and black striped semi-coiled snake-like figure in ULQ slithering over a circle drawn in ULQ of tan figure; charcoal grey background
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Snake, Mexico
